text: A new way to turn off confirmation banners in Shortcuts
full-pick-text: A new way to turn off confirmation banners in Shortcuts
notes: • This happened later in the iOS 15 cycle in version 15.4.

text: An iPhone gets an always-on display with a UI element that is reminiscent of Apple Watch complications
full-pick-text: An iPhone gets an always-on display with a UI element that is reminiscent of Apple Watch complications

text: Apple brings Mail extensions to iOS and iPadOS
full-pick-text: Apple brings Mail extensions to iOS and iPadOS

full-pick-text: Apple brings Quick Note's floating window to iOS

full-pick-text: Apple demos iOS apps running on a Mac

text: Apple does some new stuff with Animoji to make it more like Bitmoji
full-pick-text: Apple does some new stuff with Animoji to make it more like Bitmoji

text: Apple gives a release date for iOS 13.1 and mentions the update on stage
full-pick-text: Apple gives a release date for iOS 13.1 and mentions the update on stage

text: Apple launches a new AirPods app for iPhone, similar to Watch app
full-pick-text: Apple launches a new AirPods app for iPhone, similar to Watch app
notes: • Instead of an app, Apple made a section in Settings at the next WWDC.

text: Apple launches an AR navigation mode for Apple Maps
full-pick-text: Apple launches an AR navigation mode for Apple Maps
notes: • A year too early, this was a feature in iOS 15.

text: Apple showcases at least one new feature coming in iOS or iPadOS 14.1
full-pick-text: Apple showcases at least one new feature coming in iOS or iPadOS 14.1
notes: • The version number wasn't stated explicitly, otherwise Fitness+ would have counted.

text: Apple shows a 'Siri Camera' (not official name) feature that lets you point the iPhone at something and use AI to understand what you're looking at
full-pick-text: Apple shows a 'Siri Camera' (not official name) feature that lets you point the iPhone at something and use AI to understand what you're looking at
notes: • Non-graded: this is also why the next iPhone will have a physical camera button

text: Apple shows off at least one iOS 16 feature that we haven't seen before
full-pick-text: Apple shows off at least one iOS 16 feature that we haven't seen before

text: Apple specifically mention RAM/Memory in the iPhone, say it will be at least 8GB, and state it is to power Apple Intelligence
full-pick-text: Apple specifically mention RAM/Memory in the iPhone, say it will be at least 8GB, and state it is to power Apple Intelligence
notes: • This pick triggered some confusion about the new three-condition risky pick rules, and it got a bit heated. But ultimately the rules were revised to clarify that the risky pick is the three conditions, and doesn't need an additional overarching pick.

text: Apple talks about App Tracking Transparency in iOS 14.5
full-pick-text: Apple talks about App Tracking Transparency in iOS 14.5

text: Apple Video and Apple Music have dedicated apps for Mac and iOS
full-pick-text: Apple Video and Apple Music have dedicated apps for Mac and iOS
notes:
• "Music and Video removed from iTunes on the Mac"
  • iTunes was eventually split up in 2019.

text: Apple will announce at least 1 new feature that will be coming later in the iOS 15 cycle
full-pick-text: Apple will announce at least 1 new feature that will be coming later in the iOS 15 cycle
notes: • ProRes video recording on the iPhone 13 Pro models will be coming "later this fall".

text: As a result of allowing sideloading on iPhone in certain countries, a major controversy about security and/or malware on iOS happens
full-pick-text: As a result of allowing sideloading on iPhone in certain countries, a major controversy about security and/or malware on iOS happens

text: At least one iOS system app is redesigned to bring its controls to the bottom of the screen
full-pick-text: At least one iOS system app is redesigned to bring its controls to the bottom of the screen
notes: • Initially, the other two rejected Stephen's argument that the lock screen counted for this. However, later on while grading another controversial pick, Steve Troughton-Smith came to Stephen's aid live and helped bolster the case that the lock screen is in fact an app.

text: Center Stage comes to the iPhone
full-pick-text: Center Stage comes to the iPhone
notes: • This was tossed out as a possible replacement Risky pick for this game after Stephen's original got invalidated, but ultimately landed as a Flexie.

text: Cursor support for iOS
full-pick-text: Cursor support for iOS
notes: • Was not mentioned in the keynote, but more information came out during the week about the new accessibility feature.

text: Dark mode for iOS
full-pick-text: Dark mode for iOS

text: External storage support on iOS
full-pick-text: External storage support on iOS

text: Improved support for ZIP archives in the Files app and framework
full-pick-text: Improved support for ZIP archives in the Files app and framework

text: iOS 10.3 with a redesigned split screen revealing the home screen and the app switcher instead of the vertical slider we have now
full-pick-text: iOS 10.3 with a redesigned split screen revealing the home screen and the app switcher instead of the vertical slider we have now
notes: • Two iPad multitasking refreshes later, a version that shows the home screen finally arrived in iPadOS 15.

text: iOS 12 features a large scale UI redesign across iOS, the biggest since iOS 7
full-pick-text: iOS 12 features a large scale UI redesign across iOS, the biggest since iOS 7

text: iOS 12 will have a focus on "faster", speed and performance optimizations being a tentpole feature
full-pick-text: iOS 12 will have a focus on "faster", speed and performance optimizations being a tentpole feature
notes:
• "It will be on a slide."
  • Ungraded examples: "faster animations, maybe 64-bit, Swift, Pro Motion, something under the scenes, maybe a built-in cache cleanup feature"

text: iOS 13 will change the system requirements, dropping devices supported by iOS 12
full-pick-text: iOS 13 will change the system requirements, dropping devices supported by iOS 12

text: iOS 14 launches in September
full-pick-text: iOS 14 launches in September

text: iOS 14.2's Shazam recognition is demoed
full-pick-text: iOS 14.2's Shazam recognition is demoed

text: iOS 14.5 will drop within 24 hours of the event
full-pick-text: iOS 14.5 will drop within 24 hours of the event
notes: • It was a week later.

text: iOS 15 drops support for the iPhone 6S
full-pick-text: iOS 15 drops support for the iPhone 6S
notes: • iOS 15 kept the 6S around for one more year, but iOS 16 finally dropped it.

text: iOS 15 gives users more home screen customization options
full-pick-text: iOS 15 gives users more home screen customization options
notes:
• Specifically not iPadOS 15.
  • This was granted but the customization options were not extensive, just turning on and off home screens, both manually and with focus modes.

text: iOS 15 releases the following week to the public
full-pick-text: iOS 15 releases the following week to the public
notes: • In other words, the week of Monday September 20th.

text: iOS 15.4 and/or macOS 12.3 get a release date
full-pick-text: iOS 15.4 and/or macOS 12.3 get a release date
notes: • They did get a window but not an actual date.

text: iOS 16 brings major changes for systemwide design customization
full-pick-text: iOS 16 brings major changes for systemwide design customization
notes:
• Also, "Apple will let users choose their own app icons, and they'll introduce new App Store categories for wallpaper and/or icon apps"
  • A reuse and double down of last year's Flexie.

text: iOS 16 is released on Monday, September 12
full-pick-text: iOS 16 is released on Monday, September 12

text: iOS 16 will bring a more "bottom-of-the-screen-centric" design to at least 1 additional app
full-pick-text: iOS 16 will bring a more "bottom-of-the-screen-centric" design to at least 1 additional app
notes: • Books as well as the Lock Screen were cited.

text: iOS 17 gets released on the week of September 18
full-pick-text: iOS 17 gets released on the week of September 18

text: iOS 18 will bring new AI features based on LLMs with some generative capabilities
full-pick-text: iOS 18 will bring new AI features based on LLMs with some generative capabilities

text: iOS 18.1 announced to ship in "October"
full-pick-text: iOS 18.1 announced to ship in "October"

text: iOS and iPadOS 15 get native HomeKit widgets
full-pick-text: iOS and iPadOS 15 get native HomeKit widgets
notes: • These came to the iOS 16 lock screen the next year.

text: iOS gets a native feature to change icons for any app you want
full-pick-text: iOS gets a native feature to change icons for any app you want

text: iOS gets a tabbed windows feature that all apps can implement
full-pick-text: iOS gets a tabbed windows feature that all apps can implement
notes: • "Tabbed windows" was acknowledged as an unclear phrase, and was intended to convey that one app could show two separate documents or views, similar to Safari's special side by side mode at the time.

text: iOS gets expanded font support
full-pick-text: iOS gets expanded font support

text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once
full-pick-text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once
notes:
• Ungraded: works in both portrait and landscape, drag and drop between apps.
  • That's iOS, as in on the iPhone.

text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once (reuse)
full-pick-text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once (reuse)
notes:
• Was originally "The Lightning port on the iPhone 14 Pro is upgraded to at least USB 3.0", but it turns out this has been rumored. This prompts a rule change. Stephen thought of a few options which became Flexies, but ultimately opts to reuse Federico's Risky pick from the last game, word for word (a legal choice under the Bill).
  • Federico, oddly, argues for this being correct, with the Dynamic Island allowing multiple app use. But the others agree that, while funny, that isn't it.

text: iOS gets the ability to change default apps from those that Apple make, including email
full-pick-text: iOS gets the ability to change default apps from those that Apple make, including email

text: iOS will get the ability the ability to lock the phone to portrait, but continue watching videos in landscape
full-pick-text: iOS will get the ability the ability to lock the phone to portrait, but continue watching videos in landscape

text: iWork updates for iOS 12
full-pick-text: iWork updates for iOS 12
notes:
• A week after grading, there is some controversy from the listeners and Federico, as iWork did get updated (well, slightly, a few basic Shortcut actions were added), it just wasn't mentioned in the keynote. Stephen proposes a placating half point, but Myke stands firm that "there are no half points around here." This seems to be the last time that half points were ever considered for a pick.
  • The big iWork update eventually came in 2019.

text: Legacy widgets are completely removed from the system, and there is no longer a place to put widgets to the left of the main home screen
full-pick-text: Legacy widgets are completely removed from the system, and there is no longer a place to put widgets to the left of the main home screen
notes: • Legacy widgets finally met their end at WWDC 2024, but the space for new-fashioned widgets remained.

full-pick-text: macOS Sequioa released with iOS 18

full-pick-text: Memoji will get updated to include face coverings

full-pick-text: More flexibility for app icon placement on the iPhone home screen

full-pick-text: New Animoji in iOS 13

text: New features for FaceTime
full-pick-text: New features for FaceTime

text: New notification management options
full-pick-text: New notification management options

text: No specific date for iOS 14's release
full-pick-text: No specific date for iOS 14's release
notes: • Originally a candidate for Myke's Risky Pick.

full-pick-text: On iOS 12, the home screen features more than just app icons
notes: • WIdgets would finally be added to the home screen in iOS 14.

full-pick-text: Shortcuts 2.0 is showed off at WWDC with a new developer framework for apps
notes: • "Shortcuts also gets folders and AirPlay actions in 2019."

full-pick-text: Shortcuts gets an API on iOS and iPadOS for apps to run Shortcuts directly, without URL schemes

full-pick-text: Shortcuts gets new actions or triggers for USB connections

full-pick-text: Siri on iOS will gain more verbal responses, speak more than it does now when activated with your voice
notes:
• "It can hold longer conversations without the user needing to look at the screen."
  • This was graded as a half point or a "kinda".

text: Some Mac-only Shortcuts actions will become available on iPhone and iPad
full-pick-text: Some Mac-only Shortcuts actions will become available on iPhone and iPad

full-pick-text: Some new iOS 18 features will be exclusive to the iPhone 15 Pro line
notes: • Was originally just "iPhone 15 line" but it was pointed out that the plain 15 phones have the same processor as the 14 Pro.

text: Something in iOS 18 picks up the UI used in the iOS 17 App picker in Messages
full-pick-text: Something in iOS 18 picks up the UI used in the iOS 17 App picker in Messages

text: The iPhone 14 Pro Camera app introduces some kind of 3D capturing functionality
full-pick-text: The iPhone 14 Pro Camera app introduces some kind of 3D capturing functionality

text: The new Capture button...
full-pick-text: The new Capture button: Supports at least two user-configurable gestures, Will support third-party camera apps in addition to the system camera, Will integrate with the Controls API to configure various commands
notes:
• "Supports at least two user-configurable gestures"
  • "Will support third-party camera apps in addition to the system camera"
  • "Will integrate with the Controls API to configure various commands"

text: The next version of iOS brings at least one new AirPods-related feature
full-pick-text: The next version of iOS brings at least one new AirPods-related feature
notes: • Adaptive audio was introduced.

text: The next version of iOS brings changes to notifications
full-pick-text: The next version of iOS brings changes to notifications
notes: • Ungraded: a new design, better management

text: The next version of iOS lets you change icons for apps natively
full-pick-text: The next version of iOS lets you change icons for apps natively
notes: • "Without Shortcuts or custom profiles."

text: The Passwords feature of Settings becomes a standalone app
full-pick-text: The Passwords feature of Settings becomes a standalone app

text: There is a new system for changing the colors of icons on the home screen
full-pick-text: There is a new system for changing the colors of icons on the home screen

text: There will be a system filter for "always-on display" in Focus
full-pick-text: There will be a system filter for "always-on display" in Focus
notes: • Deemed incorrect because it wasn't mentioned and there was no way to find out at the time of grading. This was in fact the correct decision, as it was not present in iOS 16 originally. The feature did eventually arrive in iOS 16.4, so this pick was just a bit early.

text: There will be changes to the drawing/sketching interface used for screenshots, notes, etc.
full-pick-text: There will be changes to the drawing/sketching interface used for screenshots, notes, etc.
notes: • "Maybe it will even be an API."

text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
full-pick-text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
notes: • Edited to clarify "third party" as a few Apple widgets are already interactive.

text: Tools for developers to make smoother or faster animations in iOS
full-pick-text: Tools for developers to make smoother or faster animations in iOS
notes: • As seen in this WWDC session.

text: We get a release window for 18.1
full-pick-text: We get a release window for 18.1

text: We see at least one new Dynamic Island feature
full-pick-text: We see at least one new Dynamic Island feature

text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
full-pick-text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
notes: • The boolean operator "and" ends up taking this pick down, as interactivity wouldn't come until 2023.

text: Workflow 2 will appear as a system feature or app
full-pick-text: Workflow 2 will appear as a system feature or app
notes:
• "Heavy on Siri integration, framework for pro apps to talk to each other"
  • Ungraded: probably a migration tool from version 1, the App Store version might be kept around for a while
  • Some contention during grading about pro apps talking to each other leads to clarification that the entire pick must be true, but this one is deemed close enough.

text: WWDC will introduce a multi-year plan to move macOS and iOS closer
full-pick-text: WWDC will introduce a multi-year plan to move macOS and iOS closer
notes: • Mac Catalyst and SwiftUI deemed to fulfill this

text: You will be able to control which data types show on the always-on lock screen
full-pick-text: You will be able to control which data types show on the always-on lock screen
notes:
• Similar to the privacy controls that the always-on Apple Watch has for complications
  • This could have been a feature at the time, but there was no way to know at the time of grading. With the OS now released, we know that it was not present after all.

text: You will be able to create Shortcuts with the new LLM-infused Siri in iOS 18
full-pick-text: You will be able to create Shortcuts with the new LLM-infused Siri in iOS 18
